sentences.english: In chapter three, I discuss the negative influence of Ito Hirobumi's constitutional thought on modern Japan.
sentences.chinese: 第三章，伊藤博文政体思想对近现代日本的消极影响。

definition: Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
Oukubo Toshimichi (1830-1878), Japanese politician
Prince KONOE Fumimaro (1891-), Japanese nobleman and militarist politician, prime minister 1937-1939 and 1940-1941
Tang Shaoyi (1862-1939), politician and diplomat
Song Jiaoren (1882-1913), politician of the revolutionary party involved in the 1911 Xinhai revolution, murdered in Shanghai in 1913
Duan Qirui (1864-1936), commander of Beiyang Army under Yuan Shikai, then politician and powerful warlord
Wu Tingfang (1842-1922), diplomat and lawyer
Zhang Zhidong (1837-1909), prominent politician in late Qing
Tojo Hideki (1884-1948), Japanese military leader hanged as war criminal in 1948
Lu Zhengxiang (1871-1949), Chinese diplomat and Catholic monk
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Hirohito, personal name of the Shōwa 昭和[Zhao1 he2] emperor of Japan (1901-1989), reigned 1925-1989
An Jung-geun or Ahn Joong-keun (1879-1910), Korean independence activist, famous as assassin of Japanese prime minister ITŌ Hirobumi 伊藤博文[Yi1 teng2 Bo2 wen2] in 1909
